alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 5:44PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Rapid rises along the East Fork of the Carson River are expected due to excessive rainfall that occurred upstream in the Tamarack burn scar. The river gage on the East Fork of the Carson River at Markleeville reported a rise of 3 feet and may continue to rise. * WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following county, Douglas, and the East Fork of the Carson River. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated and may continue to rise this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM PDT, gauge reports indicated a rapid rise on the East Fork of the Carson River at Markleeville due to a torrential rainfall event. Rapid river rises can be dangerous due to a sudden rise in water levels. - The East Fork of Carson River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gardnerville, Gardnerville Ranchos, Junction U.S 395 And NV 756 and Minden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away from the East Fork of the Carson River. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
